examples.title: The Playboy of the Western World; a Comedy in Three Acts
examples.text: -- I'm thinking you'll be a loyal young lad to have working around, and if you vexed me a while since with your leaguing with the girls, I wouldn't give a thraneen for a lad hadn't a mighty spirit in him and a gamey heart.

examples.title: General John Regan
examples.text: "I don't care a thraneen," said Doyle, "what you called me, and I'll give you leave to call me that and more every day of the week if you see your way to get the Â£100 out of the American gentleman."

examples.title: Strangers at Lisconnel
examples.text: She now sat on one side of the blind woman, and stirred her tea for her, and on the other Dan O'Beirne shook his head in regretful confirmation of the opinion pronounced by the Drumroe doctor, which was reported to be that mortal man couldn't do her a thraneen of good.

examples.title: New Irish Comedies
examples.text: "You thraneen," she'd say, "you little trifle of a son!"

note: The word 'thraneen' comes from an Irish word meaning 'a piece of dried grass'.
